content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Max Müller from Germany. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in München. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Hello Max, it's a pleasure to meet you. I'm sure you'll find the apartment to be a comfortable and convenient place to live. Regarding the rental price, I'm open to discussing a fair market value that reflects the quality and location of the property. How much were you considering?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Thank you, Mister Schmidt. I appreciate the opportunity to negotiate the price. As a student, I'm looking for the best deal possible, but I also understand the value of this apartment in the city center. Would you be willing to start at a lower price, considering that it's unfurnished and I would need to provide all the furniture?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max, I'm sure you'll find that the location more than makes up for the unfurnished state of the apartment. As a landlord, I'm looking to strike a balance between what's fair for me and what's affordable for you. How much lower were you thinking?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, I believe that a fair price would be around €800 per month, considering the location and the fact that I would need to furnish the apartment myself. Would you be willing to meet me at this price?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max, I appreciate your offer, but €800 is significantly lower than what I was expecting. The location of this apartment is prime, and it's a brand new building with all the modern amenities. I think a price closer to €1,200 would be more in line with the value of the property. What do you think?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, €1,200 is quite high for a student like me. I would be willing to pay €950 if the apartment is in excellent condition and close to public transportation. Would you be willing to meet me at this price?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max, while €950 is more in line with what I had in mind, I'm still not sure if it reflects the full value of the property. The location is highly sought after, and the apartment is brand new with all the latest features. Could we perhaps meet in the middle at €1,050? This would still be a good deal for you considering the benefits of living in the city center. What do you say?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, €1,050 is a more reasonable offer. However, as a student, I'm on a tight budget, and I'm looking to save as much as possible. Would you be willing to throw in some additional amenities, such as free parking or a storage unit, to make the €1,050 more attractive?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max, I understand your budget concerns and the importance of finding ways to save. While I can't offer free parking or a storage unit with the apartment, I could consider including some basic furniture for the living area, such as a sofa and a coffee table, to help you get started. Would this sweeten the deal for you at €1,050 per month?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, having some basic furniture would be very helpful and would indeed sweeten the deal. I think with these additional considerations, I could agree to €1,050 per month. Thank you for your willingness to work with me on this. Is there anything else I should know about the apartment before we finalize the agreement?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max, I'm glad we've reached an agreement that works for both of us. The apartment is in excellent condition, and you'll have access to all the amenities the building has to offer, including a fitness center and a rooftop terrace with a stunning view of the city. I'm confident you'll be very happy living there. Would you like to proceed with the paperwork to formalize the lease?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, I'm excited about the apartment and the amenities. I'd be happy to proceed with the paperwork. Just to confirm, the final price will be €1,050 per month, and I'll have some basic furniture in the living area?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Yes, Max, the final price will be €1,050 per month, and you will have some basic furniture in the living area, as we discussed. This includes a sofa and a coffee table. We'll prepare the paperwork to reflect these terms. Is there anything else you need to discuss before we move forward?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: No, Mister Schmidt, I think we've covered everything. I'm looking forward to signing the lease and moving into the apartment. Thank you for your time and for working with me on the price. I appreciate your understanding of my situation as a student. Is there anything else I need to do to finalize the lease?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max, you're welcome, and I'm glad we could find a solution that works for both of us. To finalize the lease, we'll need to go through the standard application process. You'll need to fill out a rental application form and provide some basic documentation, such as your ID, proof of income, and a reference from your previous landlord. Once we've reviewed your application and everything is in order, we'll sign the lease agreement and you can start looking forward to moving in. Is there anything specific you'd like to know about the application process?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: No, Mister Schmidt, I understand the application process. I'll make sure to gather all the necessary documents and submit the rental application form as soon as possible. Thank you again for your assistance and for providing me with a great place to live. I'm looking forward to a smooth transition and a positive landlord-tenant relationship. Is there anything else I should know before I leave today?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max, there's nothing more to discuss at this time. I'll have the application forms and instructions ready for you. If you have any questions or need assistance with anything else, please don't hesitate to contact me. I'm here to help. Once again, thank you for choosing my apartment, and I hope you'll be very happy here. Enjoy the rest of your day!
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Thank you, Mister Schmidt. I'll make sure to complete the application process as soon as possible. I'm looking forward to moving in and making this my new home. TERMINATE
name: Max Müller from Germany
